Question: You are the project manager for an IT project with an 5 months duration and a Budget at Completion (BAC) = $500,000. After two months you have following input for your status reporting: PV = $300,000, EV = $200,000, AC = $350,000. TCPI at EAC, TCPI at BAC?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2860] >> TCPI (at BAC) = (BAC- EV) / (BAC - AC)
TCPI (at EAC) = (BAC - EV) / (EAC - AC)

Question: You are working on a project with a team size of 100 people. Your company found another very lucrative project and for that purpose 70 more people are required. Note:
[Qno: PML_2824] >> Existing Team size 101 therefore communication channels are 101*100/2= 5050
New team size is 1+30% of 100 + 2 = 33 therefore communication channels in new team = 33*32/2 =528. Total drop in communication channels is 4522

Question:
You are a PMO manager and you collected following information about a project in Organization Process Assets
Target Cost: $200,000, Target Profit = $18,000, Target Price= $218,000, Minimum Fee: $13000, Maximum Fee: $28,000 Buyer/share ration: 70/30.
Further you enquired from account department and come to know that actual cost to complete this project was $212,000. What is cost of contract of this project?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2822] >> Target Cost (TC)= 200000 (Any $ spent over it will be deducted from the seller’s profit but buyer also bear the price)
Target Profit (TP)= 18000
Target Price (TPR)= 218000
Minimum Fee (MINF)= 13000
Maximum Fee (MAXF)= 28000
Buyer/Seller Ratio= 70% / 30%
Actual Cost (AC)= 212000

Cost Saving = Target Cost - Actual Cost
:Cost Saving -12000
Seller’s Share in Cost Saving= -3600
Actual Fee (AF) = Seller’s Share in Cost Saving + Target Profit
:AF 14400
Actual Fee Paid= (If actual fee is less than min fee than min fee is paid. If actual fees is more than max fee than max is paid else actual fees is paid)
Cost of Contract = Actual Cost + Actual Feed Paid
Cost of Contract 226400
Profit= -8400

Question:
You are a PMO manager and you collected following information about a project in Organization Process Assets
Target Cost: $200,000, Target Profit = $18,000, Target Price= $218,000, Minimum Fee: $13000, Maximum Fee: $28,000 Buyer/share ration: 70/30.
Further you enquired from account department and come to know that actual cost to complete this project was $212,000. What is profit on this project?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2823] >> Target Cost (TC)= 200000 (Any $ spent over it will be deducted from the seller’s profit but buyer also bear the price)
Target Profit (TP)= 18000
Target Price (TPR)= 218000
Minimum Fee (MINF)= 13000
Maximum Fee (MAXF)= 28000
Buyer/Seller Ratio= 70% / 30%
Actual Cost (AC)= 212000

Cost Saving = Target Cost - Actual Cost
:Cost Saving -12000
Seller’s Share in Cost Saving= -3600
Actual Fee (AF) = Seller’s Share in Cost Saving + Target Profit
:AF 14400
Actual Fee Paid= (If actual fee is less than min fee than min fee is paid. If actual fees is more than max fee than max is paid else actual fees is paid)
Cost of Contract = Actual Cost + Actual Feed Paid
Cost of Contract 226400
Profit= -8400

Question: You are a project manager of a fixed-price-incentive firm contract which has the following characteristics: target cost: $180,000, target fee: $19,000, price ceiling: $210,000, sharing ratio: 60/40. How much will the contractor be reimbursed if the cost of performing the work is $185,000?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2834] >> Target Cost (TC)= 180,000 (Any $ spent over it will be deducted from the seller’s profit but buyer also bear the price)
Target Profit (TP)= 19,000
Target Price (TPR)= 199,000
Ceiling Price (CP)= 210,000 (Any $ spent over it seller will pay from his own pocket)
Buyer/Seller Ratio 60% / 40%
Actual Cost (AC) 185,000

PTA = (Ceiling Price - Target Price)/Buyers Ratio + Target Cost
:PTA 198,333
Cost Overrun @ PTA = PTA - Target Cost
:Cost Overrun @ PTA= 18,333
Buyer Seller (Price up to PTA will be shared by buyer & seller in agreed ratio. Any extra penny will be deducted without sharing from the profit of seller.)
60% / 40%
11000 / 7,333 (Cost below PTA will be shared between buyer and seller)

Seller’s Profit Cut 1= 7,333 (Profit cut associated with AC up to PTA)
Seller’s Profit Cut 2= - (Profit cut associated with AC above PTA and less then ceiling price) (AC- PTA)
Total Profit Cut= 7,333 (Profit Cut 1 + Profit Cut 2)
Profit paid to vendor= Target Profit - Profit Cut because of Actual cost is above than Target cost
:Profit paid to vendor= 11,667 (Negative means loss)
Profit to buyer= PTA - Actual Cost
:Profit to buyer= 13,333 Negative means loss
Total cost paid by Buyer= Actual Cost + Profit to Vendor
:Total cost paid by Buyer= 196,667 Also known as cost of contract

Inform the stakeholder that work not stated in the scope statement is excluded from the project.
Modify the scope statement after an approved change request has been received from the stakeholder.
Modify the scope statement to reflect the new deliverable.

Question: As Project Manager how would you best avoid scope creep?
Note: [Qno: PML_207] >> Because of business need changes are inevitable part of today’s business. So neither we can stop them, nor dare to reject them. The best way is implement only approved changes.

Answers: Insist in defining the scope at the beginning of the project.
Insist that all change be approved.
Insist that all changes be made by a formal change request.
Do not accept any change Request in execution phase

Question: You are the project manager of a real estate project. The scope of the current project in hand is similar to your previous project done by you. Which of the following you might consider?
Note: [Qno: PML_214] >> Reusing WBS helps you knowing the list of deliverables. Other inputs mentioned cannot be used because this is different project.

Answers: Use the previous project’s WBS as a template.
Use the previous project’s product description when writing the scope statement.
Use the previous project’s schedule as a template.
Use the previous project’s cost-benefit analysis as justification for this project.

Question: You are the project manager in a Telecom project. The central government telecom regulatory body has passed a new telecom bill in parliament. This new government regulation will change your project scope. For the project to move forward and be in accordance with the new regulation, you next action should be?
Note: [Qno: PML_228] >> As soon as PM realizes this kind of change he himself can present this change to CCB. CCB decides whether to do this change or not and when. After that feasibility study and finally prepare the new baselines

Answers: Prepare a new baseline to reflect the government changes.
Call a meeting to notify management.
Present the change to the Change Control Board.

Question: During a meeting with your project client he offered you a substantial monetary incentive to alter the configuration of the product to meet the  need. This change may result in additional project costs and schedule delays. The appropriate action to take would be:

Answers: Accept the offer and issue and internal configuration change request to your design team.
Obtain additional information about the request and need before accepting the offer.
Refrain from accepting the offer and advise the customer to submit a request to the change control board.
Delay acceptance of the offer until you can ensure that you can protect yourself from any legal liabilities.

Question: The process of defining and documenting stakeholders’ needs to meet the project objectives is called?
The HR manager write you an email and in that he asks you to a change the calculation method of a field on screen. This is considered as what of the following?
Note: [Qno: PML_257] >> 1 is not true. Because this is not routine activity that he does.

Question: The Work Breakdown Structure is:

Answers: a product oriented structure which shows the component elements necessary to produce the project deliverables.
an assignment oriented structure which shows which individuals are responsible for each of the project deliverables.
an activity oriented structure which shows which work components have been assigned to which organizational unit.
a deliverable oriented structure that organizes and defines the total scope of the project.

Question: For collect requirement process you hired trained moderator to run and manage the focus groups. What do you want to achieve by doing this?

Answers: To learn about the requirements and opportunities from potential providers
To bring together identified stakeholders and subject matter experts to learn about their expectations and attitudes about a proposed product, service, or result.
To work with initial project team and know whether the team will be able to understand the requirement and deliver the solution or some change is required
External moderator is hired to select a quality team members who can be get involved in project execution.\

Question: You collected feedback from a group of experts. But the responses are only available to the facilitator to maintain anonymity. Which technique are you using?
Which of the following is not included into product analysis?
Note: [Qno: PML_278] >> Earn value tool-technique is part of Cost Control.

Question: The features and functions that characterize a product, service, or result are called?
The process of formalizing acceptance of the completed project deliverables is called?
Grouping of project elements that organizes and defines the total scope of the project is called WBS. WBS can be -----
Brainstorming and lateral thinking are -----

Answers: Organizational process assets that are used to help develop the project management plan.
Alternatives identification technique, which is a tool and technique of the estimate activity duration process.
Expert judgement tool used to develop the project scope statement.
Alternatives identification technique, which is a tool and technique of the define scope process.

Question: Project scope completion is measured against …
Note: [Qno: PML_316] >> RTM is used to trace requirement, not for checking scope completion. Product and project scope both are important.

Question: Which of the following is not true about the Delphi technique?

Answers: Individuals participating must know each other for Delphi technique to be successful.
Delphi technique is most commonly used to obtain expert opinion.
In Delphi technique participants are generally anonymous.
Delphi technique is used for requirement collection

Question: In Project Scope Management, Project documents updates is an output of all processes, except _________.
Note: [Qno: PML_2811] >> Output of collect Requirement process are Requirements Documentation, Requirements Management Plan, Requirement Traceability Matrix

Question: Which of the following not required to verify the scope
Note: [Qno: PML_2840] >> Accepted deliverables is output of this process

Question: Which of the following is not required to collect the requirement from stakeholders
Note: [Qno: PML_2841] >> Product Analysis is tool and technique required in define scope process

Question: Which one tool and technique required while you are collecting requirement as well as when defining scope?
What is 100% rule?

Answers: Total of the work at lowest level must roll up to the higher levels so that nothing is left out
Assign 100% complete to any work only after verified by the customer
It rarely works in project because it expect that project manager should deliver 100% of the feature without any extra cost.
Do not create any talk of more than 8 hours in your plan and assign 100% as soon as activity starts

Question: In the context of Control Accounts, which statement is false

Answers: Control accounts are placed at selected management points in the WBS
Each control account may include one or more work packages
Each work package must be associated with only one control account
Control accounts are directly related to charted accountant

Question: WBS Dictionary may not include

Answers: Code of account, responsible organization, work description
Resources required, cost estimates, related milestones
Acceptance criteria, Quality requirements, Contract information
Billing rate of resource, risk mitigation plan, communication requirement

Question: Requirement Management Plan does not includes

Answers: How requirement activities will be planned , tracked and report
How changes to the product, service or result requirement will be initiated
How impacts will be analyzed and authority level required for approval

Question: Decomposition is tool & technique of
Inspection is tool & technique of

Answers: Administer procurement, Close Project or Phase

Question: Expert judgement can be provided by
Which is not part of product analysis

A team of business consultants has submitted cost estimates for your project. While reviewing these estimates you found the these estimates are quite lower than those submitted for similar projects previously. What should you do?

Answers: Request the supporting details as basis of estimates from business consultants.
Question each business consultant for information about the estimate.
Reject the estimate and remove the business consultants from the project.
Accept the estimate and plan to use the additional funding as a reserve.

Question: Which of the following situations describes a violation of the PMP Professional Code of Conduct?

Answers: Receiving a gift that is within the customary guidelines of the country you are currently working in.
Use of confidential information to influence a critical decision & advancing your career.
Complaining about laws and regulations of the state or province in which project management services are provided.
Disclosing information to a customer about a situation that may have an appearance of impropriety.

Question: You are the project manager of a high visibility project. During a meeting one of the customers customer asks you to perform several additional tasks that are not included into the formal contract. What will you do?

Answers: Acknowledge the request and advise the customer to submit a formal change request.
Refuse the request and report this situation to your sponsor.
Honor the request of the customer as a sign of cooperation to ensure future business.
Get together with the project team and rewrite the scope statement.

Question: You are the project manager for a huge infrastructure project in your town. Your college time friend is bidding on the project. He asked you to give him an indication of the budget for this project so that his company do not overbid and lose the deal. What is the most appropriate response?

Answers: Give the information to your friend and inform the project sponsor so that the information can be shared with the other bidders as well. There is no harming in sharing information and knowledge. It is encouraged by PMI.

Tell your friend that this is last time I am hearing this from you. If you persist you many have to compromise your job because of personal integrity & conflict of interest. Decline to give him the information.
Give the information to your friend, only if you have confidence on his character and you can trust him fully, otherwise avoid.
Tell your friend that you will give him the information if he will promise not to tell anyone and help you in resolving some other critical problem on the project.

Question: Since last one year you are working on an international project which involves team from all part of the world. One day from your home location you receive a call from your best friend and he mentions that he has joined a new company and he has been assigned a project manager to a Japanese project. He is looking for your support in this project. What would you recommend him?

Answers: It is unethical to talk about friend’s project who is working with other company so I will change the topic.
Japan is high tech country so for any technical suggestion you should listen to locals otherwise there can be other difficulties.
Provide cultural awareness training to your team and get involve in this.
Japan is very costly country therefore you should hire resources from other country to make profit on the project.

Question: In a phase end review meeting with your customer he requests a small scope change. Using the analogous estimating technique you estimated that work will take another 3 days to complete. The customer expects you to implement the change without delays and additional costs. What is your next step?

Answers: Refuse to work on the new change. You tell to the customer that no last moment change can be accepted, it is not a good practice to introduce last moment change
You know the customer has enough budget to cover the requested change. Consider the change as an opportunity to increase your profit.

Apply the integrated change control process as outlined in your project management plan. Present the change request to the project’s CCB and let the board decide if the cost for implementing the change is accepted.

You are very keen to ensure customer satisfaction. Use this opportunity to increase customer satisfaction and use your contingencies reserves to cover the additional cost. So that you can get the new business from customer

Question: You have scheduled a bidder conference next week Monday with potential vendors to discuss a procurement. Today, the senior management informed you that there is a very high probability for the project to be cancelled. What should you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2799] >> There is no point in having the meeting and wasting time if there is a high probability for the project to be cancelled.

Answers: Go ahead with the meeting but inform the vendors that the project may be cancelled
Go ahead with the meeting as usual
Wait till next Monday and observe the change in the status

Question: You are managing a project in a foreign country, where you realize that to get things done in your project, you may have to pay some tips to the government officials. You should:
Note: [Qno: PML_2800] >> This is a bribe, and should not be paid because it is unethical by PMI standards

Answers: Pay the tips to the officials because otherwise they could cause delays in project
Make a case for why tips should be paid to government officials, and present it to your management
Instead of paying cash, you provide small donation to government run NGO to get their support
Refuse to pay the tips because they are asking for bribe and hence it is unethical

Question: You are the project manager for a construction company that wants to build a shoe factory without any 100% wastage treatment plant. Although the project owner and sponsor have got the legal approval from the government yet some of the local and NGO have approached you with concerns regarding the potential impact to the environment. In this case, you must:
Note:
[Qno: PML_2801] >> The project management team must identify the stakeholders, determine their requirements, and then manage and influence the requirements to ensure a successful project. Local residents and NGO are the stakeholders in this project.
Option 1: This is not appropriate because we are ignoring an important stakeholder. Option 2: As a project manager, it is your responsibility to manage requirements of different stakeholders. This option requires you to shirk from your responsibility and ask your company management to take the necessary steps. Option 3: All stakeholders must be managed properly for successful completion of the project

Answers: Go ahead as planned, because all the legal approvals have been received
Communicate this issue to the senior management of the company and ask them to take the necessary steps
Put the interests of the construction company high on the list, while trying to resolve any conflicts with other people in the locality and NGO
Try to find appropriate resolution of issues between the different stakeholders

Question: A project manager has disclosed some crucial information to a prospective seller. Which code of professional conduct did he violate?

Answers: Refrain from offering or accepting inappropriate payments, gifts etc.
Maintain and satisfy the scope and objectives

Question: You are in the vendor management department of your company, and are responsible for sourcing interior design material for your company. You recently visited a marketing conference, where you were offered a gift-voucher for $ 200 by one of the event sponsor for attending the conference. What should you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2803] >> A project manager has the responsibility to refrain from offering or accepting inappropriate payments, gifts, or other forms of compensation for personal gain, unless in conformity with applicable laws or customs of the country where the project management services are being provided.

Answers: Return the gift because it could be construed as personal gain
Accept the gift because it is compensation for your attending the conference
Accept the gift and also inform your manager
Accept the gift because it is for a small amount, and was provided to everyone in the conference.

Question: A project manager is reviewing the performance reports of his project, he notice that the CPI is 1.45 and SPI is 0.75 - what should he do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2804] >> Since SPI is 0.75, the project is behind schedule. But since CPI is 1.45, you are comfortable from a funding point of view. Therefore evaluate the options to crash or fast track the project

Answers: Make changes to the performance baseline to improve the SPI
Inform management why the project will be delayed
Tell the team-members that they have to meet the target dates as mentioned in the project schedule.
Evaluate options to crash or fast-track the project

Question: In an informal discussion you had with another PMP, he mentioned about how he was able to sit for the PMP Certification Exam 3 years ago through using false contact hour certificates. You should:
Note: [Qno: PML_2805] >> It is responsibility of a project Manager that upon a reasonable and clear factual basis he should report possible violations of the PMP Code of Professional Conduct by individuals in the field of project management.

Answers: Report this to the your manager
Do nothing since he is a colleague
Do nothing since he had taken the PMP Exam three years ago, and contact hour certificates get audited only for one year

Question: You are managing a project in a foreign country, where you realize that you will have to pay a fee to some government agencies to get your work done. What should you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2806] >> Fees are ethical donations that may be required during a project

Answers: Refuse to pay the fee because they are bribes and hence unethical
Make a case for why fees should be paid to government agencies, and present it to your management
Instead of paying the fee, give donations to their social projects to get their support
Pay the fee to the government agencies

Question: A team member brings to your notice a risk that was not mentioned in the Risk Response Plan. What should you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2807] >> If a risk emerges that was not anticipated in the risk response plan, or its impact on objectives is greater than expected, the planned response may not be adequate. It may be necessary to perform additional risk response planning to control the risk.

Answers: Perform Additional Risk Response Planning to control the risk

Question: You are the project manager of a manufacturing firm that produces machine parts required in airplane. While doing a review, you discover some design requirements are missing. What should you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_2808] >> Option 3 is the only option that solves the problem. Since a requirement was missed, you should incorporate the requirement and do an analysis to figure out the potential impact. Option 1 is premature; you should first do an analysis to figure out impact of the change before communicating to the project sponsor. Option 2 is not recommended because it will result in a product which does not satisfy the requirements, and hence will not be accepted by the customer. Option 4 is premature; you should first do an analysis to figure out impact of the change before communicating to senior management. Escalating an issue is the last option if you cannot solve the problem yourself

Answers: Inform your project sponsor that the project may be delayed because of the missed requirement
Go forward with production because incorporating the requirement may delay the schedule
Communicate to your team that they should incorporate the requirement, and do an analysis to figure out the potential impact
Communicate this issue to your senior management

Question: In the context of project management which the followings is not Constructive Roles:
In the context of project management which of the following is a Destructive Role:
Managing conflicts is essential for successful implementation of the project. The conflict resolution techniques most used in projects are:

Your friend project manager usually did not interfere or supervise his subordinates. Since subordinates were largely unsupervised, this at times lead to anarchy. The type leadership of style used by friend is:

You are in the build phase of your project, when you realize that because of a design error, the product will not meet the performance parameters specified by the customer. In this context, what should you do first:
Note: [Qno: PML_2813] >> The first step should be to try and assess the problem with the team and try to find out if there are alternative means to solve the issue.

Answers: Discuss with your team to try to find out alternatives means to solve the issue
Ask for additional funding from your business sponsors to accommodate the new requirement
Decrease the performance parameters so that the product developed will satisfy those parameters.

Question: You are working on very critical project which will impact lives of several people in your community. To ensure success in your project, you try to provide accurate and truthful representations to the public in advertisements and through public statements made in different newspapers. This illustrates that you are good at:
Note: [Qno: PML_2814] >> Responsibility to provide accurate and truthful representations to the public in advertising, public statements and in the preparation of estimates concerning costs, services and expected results.

Answers: Ensuring successful completion of your project
Defining scope and managing customer expectations
Managing your responsibility to customer and to the public

Question: You have done your MBA from IIM and are currently working with a leading pharma company. You meet a manufacturer at a vendor conference where the he mentioned that he would like your help as a part-time consultant in a new medicine. You realize that the request of the manufacturer will not be a conflict of interest situation for your company since it is very different medicine from what your company makes. You are also interested in helping the seller because the product is innovative and you had done a project on a similar topic when you were studying at IIM. In this context, it is advisable that you should:
Note: [Qno: PML_2815] >> Once you inform the senior management, they may allow you to take up the part time assignment with the seller if they see no conflict of interest. If, on the other hand, your company sees this as conflict of interest, you can go  declining offer or leave the company. Option 3 is not recommended - you should first inform the management before accepting the offer

Answers: Decline the offer of manufacturer because it could be construed as conflict of interest by your company
Leave the company and take up the offer of manufacturer because it interests you
Accept the offer of manufacture and inform senior management
Ask your senior management whether you can participate in this venture

Question: You are discussing your project with a close friend and colleague in your company. You tell him about your problem and concern that you may even lose your job because of poor performance. Your colleague mentions that he was in similar situation earlier but took out some non-critical task from the scope without informing anyone and project was not track with respect to schedule and cost. He advises the same to you. In this context, you should:
Note: [Qno: PML_2816] >> As per PMP Code of Professional conduct, whenever you are certain of some illegal activity or impropriety, you should report it to management. Clearly, taking out tasks from the project scope without proper authorization is a violation of PMI Code of professional responsibility

Answers: Get more information about how your friend was able to get the project on track so that you can do something similar for your project
Do nothing - continue with your project as if nothing happened
Try crashing and fast-tracking on your project
Inform the management about your colleague`s activities

Question: While reviewing project document project manager found that one of the land record document is not proper therefore he consulted the company lawyer but even after the meeting project manager was not satisfied by the answer. What should the project manager do now?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2817] >> Project manager is not a competent authority in the legal matter therefore he has to listen to his team members and subject matter experts.
Option 4: This is not recommended since some company information may be proprietary and should not be discussed with people outside the organization Option 3: The project manager should not bring up the issue with the senior manager since he is not competent in this matter. Option 2: This is not an improper practice and should not be reported to PMI. PMI is not a body which can discuss the procedures followed by different companies

Answers: Trust the company lawyer and go ahead with the project
Report the issue to PMI and seek their advise
Inform the senior manager about possible misconduct in the land purchase agreement
Discuss the issue with a friend who is a corporate lawyer in another firm

Question: You are in the closing phases of your project. While reviewing the product, you find the tolerances are .75 microns more than what was specified in the project requirements. This is a very minor deviation such minor deviations will not adversely impact your customer when the product is put to actual use. What should you do in this situation?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2818] >> Project Manager "Responsibility to maintain and satisfy the scope and objectives of professional services, unless otherwise directed by the customer." PMP Code of Professional Conduct, if there is any change in the project or product scope, it has to be informed to the customer who can then take an informed decision. So, Option 2 is the best choice. Option 1: The project manager should not change the project requirements or project documents without prior approval of sponsor and customer
Option 4: First the project manager should talk with the customer. Since this is a minor deviation, it may be accepted by the customer. If the customer is not satisfied with the deviation, then the project team should be asked to make changes to the product. Option 3: First the project manager should talk with the customer. Since this is a minor deviation, it may be accepted by the customer. If the customer is not satisfied with the deviation, then a change request has to be opened.

Answers: Change the project documents to allow for small deviations
Inform the customer about the deviation
Open a change request to make changes in the product
Ask your project team to make rectifications to the product

Question: Your friend tells you that he would like to borrow the accounting package software CD from you since his computer has crashed. You should:
Note: [Qno: PML_2819] >> Software is an intellectual property and should not be distributed without prior license/approval. So, option 4 is the best answer. Option 2 and 3 talk about giving out the software which is not recommended. option 4 is not valid because your friend is just asking for the software and has not started using it. So, until he starts using it, it is not a copyright violation and cannot be reported.

Answers: Report the copyright violation to the owner of the software package
Give him the software for free
Give him the software and charge some money for it
Refuse to give him the software

Question: Your company manufactures cellphones. After 10 million cellphones were sold out in the market, a research team determined that there is a malfunction in the cellphone’s batteries which could cause fatal accidents. However, the probability of such accidents happening is very low and one such accident has been reported till now. Replacing of batteries of all the cellphones would be very expensive costing more than $ 50 million. What should your company do FIRST?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2820] >> Since there is a probability of fatal accidents, it is ethical to replace all batteries without delay.
Option 1 and option 2 are unethical options as they are allowing you to wait till some major accident happens. Option 3 should definitely be done but it will not solve the immediate problem therefore this should be done after choice 4.

Answers: Do nothing - since there is only one incident out of 10 million cellphones
Allocate more money in contingency reserves of the company to handle any financial implication of having accidents due to malfunction of the batteries
Ensure that the problem is rectified in future batteries

Question: You are project management for an yearly event. You have gathered the inputs for the Estimate Activity Duration process. Which of the following tools and techniques will you employ to produce the outputs for this process?
Note: [Qno: PML_183] >> Activity list is I/O. There is not tool by name quantitatively based durations.

Answers: Expert judgement, analogous estimating, parametric estimating, three-point estimates, and reserve analysis.
Activity list, analogous estimating, three-point based durations, and alternatives identification.
Activity list, analogous estimating, expert judgement, and reserve analysis.
Expert judgement, alternatives identification, quantitatively based durations, and reserve analysis.

Question: Which of the following is an input to the Define Activities process?

After the formation of project team huge amount of time went into storming and resolving the conflicts of team members. Due to this reason your project is delayed by now. To bring the project on track what should you do now?

Your procurement manager informed you that due to transport strike it will be more delay than planned in in procuring certain material. To accommodate the change, you will add _______ time to the activity which need to be done after procurement.

To determine the amount of float for each of the scheduled activity and  network path you are you need to calculate the earliest start date, earliest finish date, latest start date, and latest finish date for each activity. Which method is this?

You are working on a project which has total duration of 90 days. Your management asks you to complete the project in 75 days because they customer does not have much time left. You convince your management that you will be able to complete the project in 78 days and completing in 75 days is not possible. How much is the total float on the critical path.
Note: [Qno: PML_2825] >> Normally critical path has either zero float or negative float. But if you can compress the complete schedule it means that critical path was having positive float which could be compressed to zero. Having positive float on critical path allows you to negotiate and compress the schedule.

Question: Which is the correct formula to calculate SPI?
Crashing does not involves
Which is not related to critical chain
Project Buffer is

Answers: Added at the end of critical chain
Added at the end of critical phase
Is not related to Critical Chain Method

Question: Resource Buffer concept is

Answers: Resources are available and they are start working on activity after informed by dependent activity resources
Resources are busy they cannot be taken away from existing assignments
Keep buffer resources always on project
Add resource buffer for each activity

Question: How do you manage a network path so that non-critical path does not become critical

Answers: Add feeding buffer on non-critical path activities
Must finish non-critical activities on time assigned by project manager
Add resource buffer on non-critical path activities
Critical path is fix and it never changes

Question: The amount of time a task can be delayed without delaying the start date of immediate next activity is called

You applied three-point estimation on a Critical path which consists of three activities. The following duration uncertainties are all calculated assuming a ±3sigma Confidence interval. The duration uncertainty estimates of the first activity is 10 days; the second activity’s duration uncertainty estimates is 15 days and the same of third activities is 18 days. Applying the PERT formula for paths, what is the duration uncertainty of the entire path?
Note: [Qno: PML_2817] >> Entire Path Duration Uncertainty Estimate = Square root of  sum of square of all uncertainty estimates = SQRT(10^2 + 15^2 +18^2)= SQRT(649) = 25.49
